intro: Microcos ugandensis, commonly known as the Uganda microcos, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or marshy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
